class_notes:
A life course approach to health recognizes that social, physical and biological factors shape health across various developmental periods. Life course epidemiology recognizes the importance of time and timing of exposures and outcomes. This course will provide an introduction to lifecourse epidemiology through readings and group discussions. The course will cover theoretical models in lifecourse studies, methodological challenges and issues related to the design of epidemiological studies that take a life course approach to understanding health. This course will provide students with the opportunity to apply epidemiological principles and methods and develop basic tools necessary to critically evaluate the existing lifecourse epidemiology literature.
Prerequisite: EPI 530.
course_description: Various topics by Epi faculty. Check OPUS/Atlas for current topics and descriptions.
